lang.#text: Five-Channel Remote Receiver
Tap the "Include" button at the back of the device.
Association Group 1
PE653 OPERATION MODE

The PE653 has several settings that modify the PE653 circuit behaviors and inter-dependencies.  These settings and modes are defined in detail in the User manual.  You may use this Configuration parameter to set these modes.

This byte set to the circuit or variable speed pump speed to activate when the Cleaner/Booster pump needs to be active. The valid settings for this field are one of the following: Booster/Cleaner Functionality not supported	= 0x01, Circuit-1 used for Booster/Cleaner = 0x02, Variable Speed pump Speed-1 used for Booster/Cleaner = 	0x03, Variable Speed pump Speed-2 used for Booster/Cleaner = 0x04, Variable Speed pump Speed-3 used for Booster/Cleaner = 	0x05, Variable Speed pump Speed-4 used for Booster/Cleaner = 0x06

This byte is used to indicate the following two pieces of information.
o	Whether the installed pump is a one or two speed pump
o	Whether the Booster/Cleaner is installed or not
The valid setting for this field is the combination (logical ORing) of these two pieces of information.  This field can have the following values applied to it: One Speed/NO = 0x00, One Speed/YES = 0x01, Two Speed/NO	= 0x02, Two Speed/YES = 0x03
FIREMAN_TIMEOUT

Used to Disable, enable and set fireman cool down durations for preventing heater over heating. The PE653 allows the user to configure whether there is a fireman cool down period associated with an attached heater (circuit 5) and if there is, how long the cool down period will be.  You may use this Configuration parameter to set these modes.
Fireman Disabled (no heater installed)
Fireman Enabled (heater installed) with no cool down period
Fireman Enabled (heater installed) with cool down period = 1 minute
Fireman Enabled (heater installed) with cool down period = 2 minute
Fireman Enabled (heater installed) with cool down period = 3 minute
Fireman Enabled (heater installed) with cool down period = 4 minute
Fireman Enabled (heater installed) with cool down period = 5 minute
Fireman Enabled (heater installed) with cool down period = 6 minute
Fireman Enabled (heater installed) with cool down period = 7 minute
Fireman Enabled (heater installed) with cool down period = 8 minute
Fireman Enabled (heater installed) with cool down period = 9 minute
Fireman Enabled (heater installed) with cool down period = 10 minute
Fireman Enabled (heater installed) with cool down period = 11 minute
Fireman Enabled (heater installed) with cool down period = 12 minute
Fireman Enabled (heater installed) with cool down period = 13 minute
Fireman Enabled (heater installed) with cool down period = 14 minute
Fireman Enabled (heater installed) with cool down period = 15 minute
TEMP_CALIBRATION_OFFSETS
Sets temperature offsets which will then be applied to the actual pool and/or spa temperature measured by the PE653.

This byte sets the amount of compensation you wish to apply to the actual water (pool/spa) reading taken by the PE653.  This value is an offset in degrees Fahrenheit and may have the value of -20F to +20F (in 1 degree increments), inclusive.  Only whole number offsets are allowed.  A setting of zero results in NO offset being applied.

This byte sets the amount of compensation you wish to apply to the actual Air (freeze protection) reading taken by the PE653.  This value is an offset in degrees Fahrenheit and may have the value of -20F to +20F (in 1 degree increments), inclusive.  Only whole number offsets are allowed.  A setting of zero results in NO offset being applied.
This byte shall always be set to zero.
This byte shall always be set to zero.
CIR_1_EV_SCHED_1

Used to set or clear the 1st of three possible ON/OFF activation schedules for Circuit-1. The PE653 allows the user to configure whether or not there will be scheduled ON and OFF times created to turn a circuit ON/OFF during a 24-hour period.  Each circuit can have up to 3 scheduled activation times applied to it. Each scheduled ON/OFF activation time MUST have a valid ON and OFF time assigned.  The ON and OFF times are 16-bit values and minutes from midnight (where midnight equals 0).
This byte set to the high 8-bits of the 16-bit schedule ON time
This byte set to the low 8-bits of the 16-bit schedule ON time
This byte set to the high 8-bits of the 16-bit schedule OFF time
This byte set to the low 8-bits of the 16-bit schedule OFF time

POOL_SPA_SUPPORT_MODE
Used to select whether the PE653 is controlling a POOL only, SPA only or both POOL and SPA
A POOL ONLY installation
A SPA ONLY installation
Both a POOL and SPA are part of the installation
VSP_SPD_SETTING_1

Used to set the variable speed pumps 1st activation speed (VSP Speed 1). Some installations will have a Variable Speed Pump installed instead of a one or two speed pump.  In these installations the PE653 allows the user to configure what the activation speeds for the four variable speed pump speed settings will be set to.  The range for these settings is a 400 to 3450 RPM (inclusive), in 10 RPM increments.  The high end of the speed range can be further restricted via the VSP maximum speed configuration setting (see configuration parameter 0x31 description for more details.
This byte set to the high 8-bits of the desired 16-bit pump speed setting
This byte set to the low 8-bits of the desired 16-bit pump speed setting

The range for these settings is a 400 to 3450 RPM (inclusive), in 10 RPM increments. VSP_SPD_1_EV_SCHED_1

Used to set or clear the 1st of three possible ON/OFF activation schedules for VSP Speed 1. The PE653 allows the user to configure whether or not there will be scheduled ON and OFF times created to turn a variable speed pump speed ON/OFF during a 24-hour period.  Each variable speed pump speed can have up to 3 scheduled activation times applied to it. Each scheduled ON/OFF activation time MUST have a valid ON and OFF time assigned.  The ON and OFF times are 16-bit values and minutes from midnight (where midnight equals 0). 
NOTE: Only one pump speed can be active at a time.
This byte set to the high 8-bits of the 16-bit schedule ON time
This byte set to the low 8-bits of the 16-bit schedule ON time
This byte set to the high 8-bits of the 16-bit schedule OFF time

VSP_MAX_PUMP_SPEED

Used to set the MAXIMUM speed the 4 VSP speeds can be set to. The PE653 allows the user to configure what the MAXIMUM allowable activation speed can be for any of the four variable speed pump speed settings.  The Maximum pump speed setting can be set to any of the valid PUMP Speed settings, which is the range 400 to 3450 RPM (inclusive), in 10 RPM increments.  If a Maximum Pump speed setting is applied, any existing set pump speeds that exceed the Maximum value will automatically be set to the new Maximum Speed setting.
This byte set to the high 8-bits of the desired 16-bit Maximum pump speed setting
This byte set to the low 8-bits of the desired 16-bit Maximum pump speed setting
FREEZE_CONTROL
Used to enable or disable freeze control support at the PE653

This byte sets the temperature threshold at which a freeze condition is present.  This setting is in degrees Fahrenheit and has a valid range of 34F to 44F inclusive, in 1 degree Fahrenheit increments.
This bit sets the PE653 circuit 1 to be activated upon detection of a freeze condition. Value 1 = Turn Circuit 1 ON, Value 0 = Turn Circuit 1 OFF
This bit sets the PE653 circuit 2 to be activated upon detection of a freeze condition. Value 1 = Turn Circuit 2 ON, Value 0 = Turn Circuit 2 OFF
This bit sets the PE653 circuit 3 to be activated upon detection of a freeze condition.Value 1 = Turn Circuit 3 ON, Value 0 = Turn Circuit 3 OFF
This bit sets the PE653 circuit 4 to be activated upon detection of a freeze condition. Value 1 = Turn Circuit 4 ON, Value 0 = Turn Circuit 4 OFF
This bit sets the PE653 circuit 5 to be activated upon detection of a freeze condition. Value 1 = Turn Circuit 5 ON, Value 0 = Turn Circuit 5 OFF

This byte sets the Variable Speed Pump Speed to be activated upon detection of a freeze condition.  This can be any one of the following values: NONE = 0, Variable Pump Speed 1 = 1, Variable Pump Speed 2 = 2, Variable Pump Speed 3 = 3, Variable Pump Speed 4 = 4
This byte shall always be set to zero.
